class_notes:
(Freshmen Only) - You must have permission to enroll in-person.
(Students in this course will study some of the most influential books of the last three thousand years, works that have shaped our understanding of history itself.  They include sections of the Bible, ancient historians including Herodotus, Tacitus, and Julius Caesar; Medieval chronicles, Icelandic sagas, and more recent classics including the works of Niccolo Machiavelli, Adam Smith, Thomas Malthus, Karl Marx, John Stuart Mill, Charles Darwin, Sigmund Freud, and John Maynard Keynes.  Requirements for this in-person class include participation in all discussions, three short papers, a midterm and a final.)
course_description: Part of Emory's Voluntary Core Curriculum. Certain great books have been influential across the centuries, and continue to influence the way we think, act, and understand ourselves today. Major themes of the course are the history of religion, politics, economics, biology, and psychology.
